author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
Should this be part of a larger OpenSSH.jl package rather than in a special Keygen.jl package? Note that we now have OpenSSH in Yggdrasil.

@ViralBShah 

I think we can have an `OpenSSH.jl` that adds some Julia functions on top of `OpenSSH_jil`. 

But also have an application layer that generates the correct key for different tasks. For example for Documenter, GitHub secretes, etc. This could be called `Keygen.jl` or be just part of `OpenSSH.jl`.

I am not picky about the name. ðŸ¤”

I think using our BB binaries and consolidating efforts into an OpenSSH.jl package perhaps in the JuliaCrypto org would be the right way. 

If you are up for it, let's get it moved and renamed and updated to use the BB binaries. I can invite your as a JuliaCrypto owner.
Sure. I will close this until we have a working OpenSSH.jl. Then we can talk about the application layer.
I transferred the repository, but I lost the write access I guess. I cannot change the repo name or see the projects tab.
@ViralBShah Can you give @aminya the appropriate access?
I didn't change the access. I just promoted @aminya to owner. See if that does the trick.
